image.altText: A red sign on a bus shelter reading Buy the Best, Buy SA Seafood

props.synopsis: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

title.children: Seafood sellers question if algal bloom safety message is getting through

image.altText: A black sausage dog with tan highlights around the muzzle turns its head.

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: The psychology of bringing 'mad' sausage dog Valerie in from the wild

image.altText: Crime scene tape outsideÂ a home.

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with murder after a man was reported unconscious in South Australia's mid-north on Friday and could not be revived.

title.children: Woman charged with murder of man believed to be her partner, police say

image.altText: Masooma smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

title.children: For Afghan refugee Masooma, fostering a child has given her a sense of freedom

image.altText: Man stands and looks at camera in a dairy shed.

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

title.children: South Australian farmers 'on knife edge' ahead of summer after a year of dry conditions

image.altText: Marine scientist Mike Steer.

props.synopsis: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

title.children: SA's algal bloom chief keen to hit the beach this summer

image.altText: A sign outside disability support service Bedford.

props.synopsis: Australia's second-largest disability employment provider Bedford will be kept afloat by a $4.4 million federal government funding injection as it seeks a buyer for the embattled business.

title.children: More funds announced to keep Bedford afloat as hunt for buyer continues

image.altText: A man and a woman stand in a suburban setting looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Nick and Aimee Mazza's hard-earned cash was gambled away by a man they thought was investing it. Bookmakers encouraged him to keep betting.

title.children: Couple lost $250k to gambling companies without placing a single bet

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

title.children: Why the search for a missing 4yo in SA's outback was so challenging

image.altText: a picture of a river bordered by trees looking towards the horizon on a clear day.

props.synopsis: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

title.children: Holiday-makers swap the beach for the river to avoid algal bloom

image.altText: A mum wearing a pink shirt, sitting with her two children.

props.synopsis: Parents rely on after-school care to be able to participate in the workforce, but in one SA country town, the only provider's future is unclear.Â

title.children: After-school care closure crisis leaves parents scrambling

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: Adelaide's lord mayor is confident the city will be prepared to host the event, even though it is 13 months away and Australia remains in a deadlock over hosting rights.

title.children: âWe will deliverâ: Adelaide defiant on COP31 despite host city delay

image.altText: Ryan Papenhuyzen lies with his face in the grass during the NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

title.children: The Storm seem to make grand finals for fun, but winning is just out of reach

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, leaving many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: ece Walsh of the Broncos celebrates winning the NRL Grand Final match

props.synopsis: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.

title.children: How the internet reacted to Brisbane winning the NRL grand final

image.altText: The Broncos score a controversial try

props.synopsis: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Haufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.Â

title.children: Try that decided NRLW premiership lingers as an unsolvable mystery

image.altText: An elderly woman standing in front of a burnt out car on a street.

props.synopsis: Authorities say nine regions across Ukraine were targeted by Russian night-time drone, missile and aerial bomb strikes.Â

title.children: Zelenskyy slams latest Russian 'aerial terror'

image.altText: Two F1 cars make wheel-to-wheel contact during a race.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been left furious at his teammate, and his team, after his two drivers' championship rivals gained ground on him in the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

title.children: 'That's not fair': Piastri's F1 lead cut after Norris makes lap one contact

image.altText: Older woman holds her hands over her chest.

props.synopsis: Australian women having a heart attack are less likely to be promptly diagnosed and treated compared to men, although the gender gap in cardiac care is narrowing.

title.children: Gender gap in heart attack care narrowing, but not fast enough, research finds

image.altText: A fire at the beach

props.synopsis: A "careless" campfire lit during a fire ban sparked a rapidly moving blaze that has now burnt hundreds of hectares on Moreton Island, according to authorities.

title.children: Campfire during ban blamed for Moreton Island fire

image.altText: an aerial view of a large stadium on the hobart waterfront

props.synopsis: The future of Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium rests in the hands of the state's politicians. So who will vote which way, and what is the chance it will actually get up?

title.children: The fate of Hobart's proposed stadium rests with a handful of politicians. What do they think?

image.altText: Boy rides on new green playground equipment

props.synopsis: 'Cliff riders' have sparked concern among some community members, but 20 have been installed across the country in an effort to help children learn through risk-taking.Â

title.children: Deathtrap or innovation? How new playgrounds encourage risk-taking

image.altText: Sydney street youth worker Yousif Tamim

props.synopsis: Some of Sydney's vulnerable young people are being steered away from a life of crime, addiction and homelessness by a pair of youth workers who have had their own share of hardships.

title.children: 'On their turf': Sydney street team forging links with at-risk youth

image.altText: Rescuers in hi-vis clothing looking underneath two large, collapsed concrete building layers covered in rubble

props.synopsis: The number of students confirmed dead after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school building in Indonesia has risen to 45, the country's search and rescue agency says.

title.children: Death toll from school collapse rises to 45 as more bodies recovered

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: An afternoon tea meeting with a president is not the sort of invitation you get every day as a foreign correspondent, but when I met Finland's Alexander Stubb in Helsinki, it taught me a lot about another world leader.

title.children: I got an unexpected afternoon tea invite, and it told me a lot about Trump

image.altText: People in black raincoats wade through water.

props.synopsis: Heavy rains have triggered landslides and flash floods, blocking roads, washing away bridges and killing dozens in Nepal and West Bengal, authorities said.Â

title.children: Dozens dead after landslides, flash floods in Nepal and India

image.altText: A crowded beach in front of a city skyline.

props.synopsis: Temperatures could soar to almost 10 degrees above average this week, increasing the risk of bushfires that are already burning across the state.

title.children: Spring heatwave increases fire risk as scores of blazes burn in Queensland

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a blue suit and white shirt speaking to someone out of frame.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has deployed 300 Illinois National Guard troops to Chicago after Governor JB Pritzker refused to do so.

title.children: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago

image.altText: Man and woman together at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested after arriving into Sydney on a flight from Dubai this morning.Â

title.children: Mark Latham's ex-partner charged with sharing intimate images

image.altText: Ray Martin speaks to the room.

props.synopsis: After six decades as a journalist, Ray Martin says he has learnt the secret to a long and satisfying career.

title.children: After 60 years, one piece of advice keeps this 80-year-old journalist from retiring

image.altText: Bread, jam, biscuits, dip, muesli bars and sausages on a white background.

props.synopsis: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

title.children: Why you might be paying more for reduced quality at the supermarket

image.altText: A man in a hood poses in front of a computer with the anonymous logo on it.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity analysts warn that three of the most notorious English-speaking cybercrime groups are still operating as the "super group" known as Trinity of Chaos, despite recently announcing retirement.

title.children: Inside the 'Trinity of Chaos': How young hackers are uniting to hit big companies

image.altText: A group of rifles laid out in a row on the floor.

props.synopsis: More than 100 firearms are seized in a WA Police operation targeting 'sovereign citizens' in the wake of the fatal shooting of two Victorian officers.

title.children: âA risk we cannot takeâ: Police seize 135 guns amid sovereign citizen raids

image.altText: A woman with short black hair speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan's Liberal Democratic Party's leadership contest and is likely to become the country's first female PM. Here's what we know about her.

title.children: Once a rock drummer, Sanae Takaichi is set to become Japan's first female PM

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, in a dark suit, leans against the wall of a brick home.

props.synopsis: It takes a long time to build anything at all in Australia's dysfunctional housing market, even for the federal government, but Labor's social housing fund is inching towards an impact.

title.children: Building homes like the one the PM grew up in is turning out to be harder than it sounds
